description: The federal government says it has been dealing with an unprecedented number of rumors surrounding the recent hurricanes, Helene and Milton. CBS News immigration and politics reporter Camilo Montoya-Galvez speaks with the head of U.S. Customs and Border Protection about one of those false claims. Then, CBS News national security contributor Sam Vinograd joins with further analysis.
title: Border protection head debunks false claims about FEMA funds

description: Week 6 of the NFL season kicked off Thursday night with a strong showing by the San Francisco 49ers in their 36-24 victory over the Seattle Seahawks. The Washington Commanders will take on the Baltimore Ravens, with both teams currently on winning streaks. CBS Sports HQ analyst Ryan Wilson has more on what to expect.
title: What to expect from NFL Week 6

description: At least 22 people were killed and dozens more injured after Israeli airstrikes on the Lebanese capital city of Beirut Thursday. CBS News foreign correspondent Debora Patta reports.
title: Israel conducts its deadliest attack on Beirut since start of bombardment

description: Both Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump campaigned in western battleground states Friday. Harris rallied in Arizona for the second day in a row, while Trump traveled to Nevada after speaking in Aurora, Colorado, earlier in the day. CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa has more.
title: Why Trump is campaigning in comfortably blue Colorado

description: According to breastcancer.org, one in eight women in the U.S. will develop breast cancer at some point in their lifetime. However, the type is considered one of the most curable cancers if caught early. Chief of breast surgery at New York Presbyterian Medical Center Dr. Roshni Rao answers common questions this Breast Cancer Awareness Month.
title: Doctor answers common breast cancer, mammogram questions

description: The 2024 World Wildlife Fund report found that animal populations are declining due to human-caused climate change and the global loss of nature. CBS News Los Angeles meteorologist and environmental reporter Marina Jurica reports on which species are most at risk and what can be done to reverse the trend.
title: How wildlife reacts to changing climate

description: The U.S. government announced last month it would ship out more free COVID-19 tests, a batch that appears to have a short shelf life. However, the Food and Drug Administration said it has extended the expiration dates for them. Dr. Amesh Adalja, a senior scholar at the Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security, joins "CBS News Weekender" to discuss if the tests are still accurate and how to tell if they work.
title: Should you keep your expired COVID tests?

description: Satellite photos show flooding, ruined buildings and more after Hurricane Milton.
title: Satellite photos reveal destruction caused by Hurricane Milton

description: Fake or misleading visuals, scams and overblown reports of crime have recurred after major hurricanes for years now. Here's what to watch out for.
title: Beware the "street shark" and other common hurricane misinformation

description: Former President Donald Trump's campaign requested military assets to enhance his security in the final weeks of the campaign, two sources said.
title: Trump campaign requested use of military aircraft for final stage of campaign

description: Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg wrote in a memo that the aerospace giant is cutting 10% of its 170,000 workforce.
title: Boeing says it's cutting 10% of its workforce, or about 17,000 employees

description: Authorities are investigating a cyberattack linked to China-backed hackers that targeted major U.S. telecommunications companies and systems used for intelligence collection.
title: U.S. investigating China-backed hack of telecom companies. Here's what to know.

description: Convenience-store chain 7-Eleven is closing hundreds of "underperforming" stores in North America, its Japanese-owner said.
title: 7-Eleven to close more than 400 locations. Here's what to know.

description: At least 22 killed in Beirut as Israel-Hezbollah fighting continues; President Biden provides update on hurricane recovery efforts.
title: 10/11: CBS News 24/7 Episode 2

description: The latest producer price index data may help the Federal Reserve move toward more interest rate cuts in the future as more signals appear to indicate that U.S. inflation is cooling. CBS News' Jo Ling Kent breaks down the September numbers.
title: Producer price index data may signal inflation is cooling

description: In the new episode of CBS News's “A Moment With…”, Mrs. Umut Shayakhmetova, CEO of Halyk Bank, shares how she became the CEO of the largest bank in Kazakhstan, how Halyk built its reputation, and what the future holds for the bank.
title: A Moment With: Mrs. Umut Shayakhmetova

description: Lebanese health officials say at least 22 people were killed and more than 100 were injured after an apparent Israeli strike leveled a building in Beirut. CBS News' Debora Patta reports.
title: Beirut building completely obliterated by Israeli strikes

description: A Wellington, Florida, family took cover while a tornado likely struck their home before Hurricane Milton hit. Danielle and Carter McMasters join CBS News with more on their survival story with two young children.
title: Family survived tornado before Hurricane Milton hit

description: Florida National Guard and Department of Defense personnel are in Florida to help with Hurricane Milton rescue and recovery efforts. Deputy Pentagon press secretary Sabrina Singh joins CBS News with more details.
title: How the National Guard responded to Hurricane Milton

description: Home equity borrowing could be beneficial for many homeowners right now. Here are the best options to choose from.
title: What's the best home equity borrowing option right now?

description: President Biden took questions on Hurricane Milton recovery efforts and the spread of misinformation concerning FEMA and federal support. Mr. Biden said his administration continues to help Florida and its leadership with all needs after Milton and Helene.
title: Biden denounces Hurricane Milton misinformation

description: If you're waiting for gold prices to drop before buying in, you may want to rethink that strategy. Here's why.
title: 3 big risks of waiting for gold prices to fall

description: Many Americans were able to spot the northern lights Thursday and may have another chance to do so Friday as the aurora borealis remains visible. CBS News Bay Area meteorologist Zoe Mintz breaks down the phenomenon and also looks at the latest U.S. forecast.
title: What are the northern lights?

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is in Arizona vying for support among Hispanic men as they remain a key voting group in battleground states. CBS News' Weijia Jiang has more on the 2024 election.
title: Why Kamala Harris needs more support among Hispanic men

description: Donald Trump is proposing making interest on car loans tax-deductible. But the benefit would mostly help high earners.
title: Here's who would benefit from Trump's tax plan on car loan interest

description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with Pope Francis at the Vatican as he seeks European support for his plan to defeat Russia in the war. CBS News' Ian Lee has more.
title: Why Zelenskyy met with Pope Francis

description: Lebanese officials say at least 22 people were killed during an Israeli strike in Beirut that apparently targeted a Hezbollah leader. This comes as Secretary of State Antony Blinken commented on the militant group's involvement in Israel's war against Hamas. CBS News' Haley Ott has the latest from the Middle East.
title: Latest news as Middle East conflict escalates

description: The emergency alert systems used during Hurricane Helene and Hurricane Milton are under scrutiny as local officials face more natural disasters affecting Americans. CBS News' Tom Hanson has more on Helene alerts and how FEMA's system works.
title: How emergency alerts work during hurricanes like Helene, Milton

description: Fed rate cuts can help lower loan rates, but how will the upcoming cut impact your card rates? Here's what to know.
title: Will credit card rates fall with the next Fed rate cut?

description: Cards Against Humanity counters move earlier in the month by pro-Trump super PAC funded by tech billionaire Elon Musk.
title: Cards Against Humanity offers to pay nonvoters to go to the polls

description: The ashes were released into the eye of the hurricane Tuesday night, less than 24 hours before Milton made landfall.
title: Renowned scientist's ashes dropped into eye of Hurricane Milton as tribute

description: Interest rates may be reduced again in November. Here's what prospective CD account holders should do before then.
title: 3 smart CD moves to make before the next rate cut

description: Mark Harmon transitions from his iconic role as Leroy Jethro Gibbs to executive producer and narrator of "NCIS: Origins," a prequel exploring his character's early years.
title: Mark Harmon steps back in "NCIS" as producer for "NCIS: Origins"

description: Former President Barack Obama hit the campaign trail Thursday in Pittsburgh for Vice President Kamala Harris. He made an impassioned plea, focusing his attention on Black men voters, a group Harris has struggled to gain support from. Meanwhile, former President Donald Trump campaigned in Detroit while Harris was in Arizona.
title: Obama campaigns for Harris while candidates hit swing states

description: Hurricane Milton caused massive destruction when it hit Florida, and recovery is beginning. Also, a dramatic rescue unfolded after a dozen people found themselves trapped hundreds of feet underground in a gold mine. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Massive destruction in wake of Hurricane Milton

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is working to secure votes on the campaign trail while also taking part in the Biden administration's response to Hurricane Milton. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.
title: Kamala Harris juggling campaign, VP duties amid Hurricane Milton response

description: Donald Trump is scheduled to hold rallies in Colorado and Nevada on Friday, with the former president expected to address crime and immigration. CBS News campaign reporter Olivia Rinaldi has more.
title: Trump expected to focus on crime, immigration at Colorado rally

description: Debt forgiveness could help if you're carrying tens of thousands of dollars in debt, but it's not the only option.
title: Does credit card debt forgiveness cover my $30,000 debt?

description: New data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics shows the Producer Price Index was flat in September. Dow Jones economists had predicted a tenth of a percent increase. CBS News contributor J.D. Durkin has more.
title: Producer Price Index unchanged in September

description: Sean "Diddy" Combs was back in a New York courtroom Thursday where he learned his sex trafficking and racketeering trial will begin in May. Combs has pleaded not guilty to all the charges. CBS News correspondent Lilia Luciano has more.
title: Details from Sean "Diddy" Combs' latest court hearing

description: A $60,000 HELOC comes with inexpensive monthly payments now. And they could become even cheaper in the months ahead.
title: How much does a $60,000 HELOC cost monthly now that rates are cut?

description: There's a lot of gasoline headed to Florida, but power must first be restored for terminals to receive it.
title: Florida gas stations are in need of fuel. Here's how long it could take.

description: Officials in Colorado are trying to determine what caused an accident at a gold mine tourist attraction that killed one person and trapped a dozen people for about seven hours. CBS News correspondent Carter Evans has more.
title: 1 dead, 12 rescued after malfunction at Colorado gold mine attraction

description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis provided an update Friday morning on the recovery efforts underway in Florida following the destruction of Hurricane Milton.
title: Gov. Ron DeSantis gives update on Florida recovery efforts after Milton

description: Officials in Lebanon say at least 22 people have been killed and over 100 others injured in Israeli strikes over the heart of Beirut Thursday night. CBS News foreign correspondent Deborah Patta has more.
title: What to know after Israeli strikes kill at least 22 in Beirut

description: The U.S. government is "absolutely not" diverting hurricane and disaster relief funds to subsidize the care of migrants, the top Customs and Border Protection official told CBS News.
title: Top border official: Disaster funds have "absolutely not" been diverted for migrants

description: McDonald's adds the Chicken Big Mac to its menu for a limited time, offering a fresh take on the classic sandwich with chicken patties and no onions.
title: McDonald's introduces the Chicken Big Mac

description: To stay friends or not to stay friends, that is the question for many Americans as they navigate deep political divides this election cycle. Here's what experts say.
title: Your friend loves a candidate you hate. Can your relationship survive?

description: Suzanne Simpson, 51, has been missing since Sunday night, the Olmos Park Police Department said.
title: Search continues for Texas mother missing for 5 days

description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, Elizabeth Werner shows us items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage of these exclusive deals today. CBS earns commissions on purchases made through cbsdeals.com.
title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals

description: Ellie the Elephant, the massively popular New York Liberty mascot, continues to rally fans as the team fights for its first WNBA championship.
title: Ellie the Elephant on supporting the New York Liberty's fight for WNBA championship

description: After nearly 20 years as Special Agent Gibbs, Mark Harmon is back in the NCIS world as executive producer and narrator of the new prequel, "NCIS: Origins," which stars Austin Stowell.
title: Mark Harmon on returning to NCIS world as producer of prequel "NCIS: Origins"

description: Today's "Kindness 101" lesson on adaptability features Dexter, a dog who picked himself up after a tragic accident and is now motivating others through his strength and determination.
title: "Kindness 101": Dexter the dog overcomes tragedy to inspire many

description: Florida sees roughly 50 tornadoes in a typical year. But Floridians saw nearly half of that in the hours before Milton made landfall. Multiple twisters touched down in just 30 minutes in St. Lucie County.
title: Historic number of tornadoes barreled through Florida amid Hurricane Milton

description: Israel says its fight in Lebanon is against Iran-backed Hezbollah, but residents in one tiny village say they're under attack, and they don't know why.
title: Israel's war with Hezbollah hit a tiny Lebanese village without warning

description: Missoula, Montana, police exclusively released the last-known video of Jermain Charlo, a young mom who disappeared without a trace in 2018, to "48 Hours" in hopes of generating leads. Michelle Miller reports on the case for "48 Hours."
title: Authorities release last-known video of missing Montana mom to "48 Hours"

description: Analysts estimate Hurricane Milton could have caused up to $50 billion in insured losses for Florida property owners. CBS News business analyst Jill Schlesinger explains what to do about filing a claim.
title: How to navigate insurance claims after Hurricane Milton

description: From 1950 to 1970, the Vatican sent thousands of Italian children to American Catholics for adoption. The children came on orphan visas — but most of them were not orphans; they were the children of unwed mothers, many of whom were alive. Bill Whitaker speaks with the American adoptees still searching for their Italian families, Sunday on 60 Minutes.
title: The Vatican's Orphans | Sunday on 60 Minutes

description: North Korea says South Korea flew propaganda-dropping drones over its capital city, warning the "safety lock on our trigger has now been released" in response.
title: North Korea threatens "all means of attack" over purported drone flights

description: As Israel's battle against Hezbollah continues, an Israeli airstrike in Beirut has killed 22 people and wounded dozens more, according to Lebanon's Health Ministry. It was the deadliest strike since Israel ramped up attacks in Lebanon last month.
title: Lebanon says 22 people killed in Israeli strike on Beirut

description: At least 16 people are dead as a result of Hurricane Milton, officials told CBS News.
title: Scope of hurricane damage emerges amid power outages, fuel shortages

description:
The viral Florida man known as "Lieutenant Dan" is safe after riding out Hurricane Milton on his sailboat in Tampa Bay. He told CBS News that the Category 3 storm was "pretty mellow," despite smashing his boat up against a wall.

"I'm not scared of anything," he said, adding that if another hurricane comes, "I'd remain on my boat no matter what."
title: Florida's "Lt. Dan" says he's "not scared of anything" after surviving Milton on his sailboat

description: In Colorado, 23 people were rescued after an elevator malfunction at an old gold mine. One person was killed and four others were injured while visiting the attraction. Another dozen people remained trapped underground for about six hours before they were rescued.
title: 1 dead, 23 rescued from old Colorado gold mine after some were trapped for hours

description: Hurricane Milton's historic rainfall submerged communities as first responders spent Thursday rescuing people stranded in homes and apartment buildings. The storm is responsible for at least 16 deaths.
title: At least 16 dead from Hurricane Milton as recovery efforts begin

description: Israeli forces have launched their deadliest attack over central Beirut in over a year of fighting, killing at least 22 and injuring over 100. CBS News reporter Haley Ott has more.
title: At least 22 killed in Israeli strikes over central Beirut

description: Orlando theme parks reopened for business as usual Friday, after closing for Hurricane Milton.
title: Disney World and other Florida theme parks reopen after Hurricane Milton

description: Former President Barack Obama spent Thursday on the campaign trail in Pennsylvania where he delivered a blunt message to Black men about why he believes they should be supporting Vice President Kamala Harris over former President Donald Trump. CBS News campaign reporter Taurean Small has more.
title: Obama says Black men should be supporting Kamala Harris over Trump

description: Groups in Florida are getting to work assessing some of the damage left behind by Hurricane Milton with some people returning after evacuating to find their homes completely destroyed. Reese May is the chief strategy and innovation officer for SBP, a nonprofit disaster relief organization focused on rebuilding homes after disasters. He joined CBS News to discuss the rebuilding process.
title: Recovery from Hurricane Milton begins in Florida

description: The body of one man was recovered from a dam while a woman was discovered burned to death in a shack, authorities said.
title: "Rogue" policewoman accused of murdering 6 people

description: The cleanup has begun and electric crews are working to restore power in Florida where residents are coming to grips with the destruction left by Hurricane Milton. CBS News correspondent Cristian Benavides has more.
title: At least 16 killed, 340 rescued, over 2 million still without power after Hurricane Milton

description: Police share last-known images of Montana woman, hoping to generate new leads. "Someone out there knows what happened to Jermain Charlo" says detective.
title: Watch never-before-seen video of missing Montana mom Jermain Charlo

description: BrucePac is recalling nearly 10 million pounds of meat and poultry products because they may be contaminated with listeria bacteria, which​ can cause illness and death.
title: Listeria fears prompt recall of some 10 million pounds of meat, poultry dishes

description: Andrew Irvine went missing in 1924 alongside climbing partner George Mallory as the pair attempted to be the first to reach Everest's summit.
title: Remains of climber who vanished in 1924 found on Mount Everest

description: Two U.S. Navy SEALs drowned as they tried to climb aboard a ship​ carrying illicit Iranian-made weapons to Yemen because of glaring training failures, a military probe of the January deaths found.
title: Drownings of 2 Navy SEALS were preventable, military probe finds

description: The 2024 Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to Japanese organization Nihon Hidankyo for its work to "achieve a world free of nuclear weapons."
title: 2024 Nobel Peace Prize goes to Japanese group for anti-nuclear weapons work

description: The northern lights are expected to be visible again Friday night and night mode on your camera can help capture the colorful auroras. Here's how to turn it on.
title: How to use your phone's night mode to capture the northern lights

description: Skeptics say CEO Elon Musk has yet to show Tesla's self-driving system can travel safely without human supervision.
title: Musk, Tesla unveil long-awaited "Cybercab" robotaxi

description: Dozens of rescues for those stranded by Milton; Dog rescued from rubble of Florida home destroyed by Milton
title: 10/10: CBS Evening News
